    Squared Mahalanobis Distance

    deltacapsq.Rd

    Calculates the squared Mahalanobis distance.

    deltacapsq(x, mu, sigmacap)

    Arguments

    x

    Numeric vector or matrix.

    mu

    Numeric vector. Center \(\boldsymbol{\mu}\).

    sigmacap

    Numeric matrix. Covariance matrix \(\boldsymbol{\Sigma}\).

    Value

    A vector.

    Details

    The squared Mahalanobis distance is given by $$ \boldsymbol{\Delta}^{2} = \left( \mathbf{x} - \boldsymbol{\mu} \right)^{\prime} \boldsymbol{\Sigma}^{-1} \left( \mathbf{x} - \boldsymbol{\mu} \right) $$

    References

    Wikipedia: Mahalanobis distance

    See also

    Other Scaling Functions: d(), z()

    Author

    Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan

    Examples

    x <- matrix(
  data = stats::rnorm(n = 5 * 2),
  ncol = 2
)

deltacapsq(
  x,
  mu = c(0, 0),
  sigmacap = diag(2)
)
#> [1] 2.0283189 1.7339160 0.7542988 3.0156158 0.5517988

x <- rnorm(5)

deltacapsq(
  x,
  mu = 0,
  sigmacap = 1
)
#> [1] 0.10841104 0.63646804 0.05890853 0.04305421 0.39080517
